item.name: Client connections (SSL)
item.description: The current number of concurrent connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Client SSL connections per second (compat)
item.description: The current number of concurrent compat connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Client SSL connections per second (native)
item.description: The total number of concurrent native connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Failover status
item.description: The failover status ID on the system. unknown - the failover status of the device is unknown. offline - the device is offline. forcedOffline - the device is forced offline. standby - the device is standby. active - the device is active.

item.name: Sync status
item.description: The sync status ID on the system. unknown - the device is disconnected from the device group syncing - the device is joining the device group or has requested changes from device group or inconsistent with the group. needManualSync - changes have been made on the device not syncd to the device group. inSync - the device is consistent with the device group. syncFailed - the device is inconsistent with the device group, requires user intervention. syncDisconnected - the device is not connected to any peers. standalone - the device is in a standalone configuration. awaitingInitialSync - the device is waiting for initial sync. incompatibleVersion - the device's version is incompatible with rest of the devices in the device group. partialSync - some but not all devices successfully received the last sync.

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor doing nothing for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor waiting for external I/O to complete for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor servicing hardware interrupts for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor running niced processes for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor servicing soft interrupts for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU steel time
item.description: The average time 'stolen' from the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor servicing system calls for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU average usage ratio
item.description: This is average usage ratio of CPU for the system in the last one minute. It is calculated by (sum of deltas for user, niced, system)/(sum of deltas of user, niced, system, idle, irq, softirq, and iowait), where each delta is the difference for each stat over the last 1-minute interval.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor in user context for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: The total host memory in bytes. This is for a single host system. For multiple host system, please refer sysMultiHost table.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: The host memory in bytes currently in use. This is for a single host system. For multiple host system, please refer sysMultiHost table.

item.name: Product name (marketing)
item.description: The system name used by marketing

item.name: Product build
item.description: The product build number.

item.name: Product edition
item.description: The product edition.

item.name: Product name
item.description: The product name.

item.name: Product version
item.description: The product version.

item.name: Server connections (SSL)
item.description: The current number of concurrent connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Server SSL connections per second (compat)
item.description: The total number of concurrent compat connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Server SSL connections per second (native)
item.description: The total number of concurrent native connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Client Bytes In
item.description: The number of bytes received by the system from client-side.

item.name: Client Bytes Out
item.description: The number of bytes sent to client-side from the system.

item.name: Client connections
item.description: The current connections from client-side to the system.

item.name: Client Packets In
item.description: The average number of packets received by the system from client-side in the last five seconds.

item.name: Client Packets Out
item.description: The number of packets sent to client-side from the system.

item.name: Client connects per second
item.description: The total connections from client-side to the system.

item.name: HTTP Requests per second
item.description: The total number of HTTP requests to the system.

item.name: Total memory (TMM)
item.description: The total memory available in bytes for TMM (Traffic Management Module).

item.name: Used memory (TMM)
item.description: The memory in use in bytes for TMM (Traffic Management Module).

item.name: Server Bytes In
item.description: The number of bytes received by the system from server-side.

item.name: Server Bytes Out
item.description: The number of bytes sent to server-side from the system.

item.name: Server connections
item.description: The current connections from server-side to the system.

item.name: Server connects per second
item.description: The total connections from server-side to the system.

item.name: Host name
item.description: The host name of the system on the network.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: The system up time in 1/100 seconds since boot.

item.name: Client accepts per second
item.description: The number of connections accepted.

item.name: SNMP trap for F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB notifications
item.description: A private enterprise MIB for F5 Networks Top-level infrastructure of the F5 enterprise MIB tree.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} current sessions
item_prototype.description: The number of current sessions going through the specified node address.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} incoming bytes
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes received by the specified node address from server-side.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} outgoing bytes
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes sent to server-side from the specified node address.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} current server connections
item_prototype.description: The current connections from server-side to the specified node address.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} incoming packets
item_prototype.description: The number of packets received by the specified node address from server-side.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} outgoing packets
item_prototype.description: The number of packets sent to server-side from the specified node address.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} available
item_prototype.description: The availability of the specified node address indicated in color. none - error. green - available in some capacity. yellow - not currently available. red - not available. blue - availability is unknown. gray - unlicensed.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} state
item_prototype.description: The activity status of the specified node address, as specified by the user.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmNodeAddrStatusEnabledState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmNodeAddrStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>1
trigger_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} is not available in some capacity: {ITEM.VALUE2}

item_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} available
Pool {#SNMPVALUE} enabled
item_prototype.description: The activity status of the specified pool, as specified by the user.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmPoolStatusEnabledState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmPoolStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>1
trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is not available in some capacity: {ITEM.VALUE2}

discovery_rule.name: Virtual server status discovery
discovery_rule.description: The name of a virtual server.

item_prototype.name: Virtual server {#SNMPVALUE} availability
Virtual server {#SNMPVALUE} enabled
item_prototype.description: The activity status of the specified virtual server, as specified by the user.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmVsStatusEnabledState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmVsStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>1
trigger_prototype.name: Virtual server {#SNMPVALUE} is not available in some capacity: {ITEM.VALUE2}

item_prototype.name: VS {#SNMPVALUE} current connections
item_prototype.description: The number of current connection terminated on virtual server.

item_prototype.name: VS {#SNMPVALUE} incoming bytes
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes received from client to the specified virtual server.

item_prototype.name: VS {#SNMPVALUE} outgoing bytes
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes sent to client from the specified virtual server.

item_prototype.name: VS {#SNMPVALUE} incoming packets
item_prototype.description: The number of packets received from client to the specified virtual server.

item_prototype.name: VS {#SNMPVALUE} outgoing packets
item_prototype.description: The number of packets sent to client from specified virutal server.

discovery_rule.name: Chassis fan discovery
discovery_rule.description: The index of a chassis fan on the system. It identifies a particular chassis fan.

item_prototype.name: Chassis fan {#SNMPVALUE} speed
item_prototype.description: The actual speed of the indexed chassis fan on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the actual fan speed data is available. '0' means fan speed is unavailable while the associated chassis status is good.

item_prototype.name: Chassis fan {#SNMPVALUE} status
item_prototype.description: The status of the indexed chassis fan on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the sensor data is available.

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis fan {#SNMPVALUE} is in bad state

discovery_rule.name: Power supply discovery
discovery_rule.description: The index of a power supply on the system.

item_prototype.name: Power supply {#SNMPVALUE} status
item_prototype.description: The status of the indexed power supply on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the sensor data is available.

trigger_prototype.name: Power supply {#SNMPVALUE} is in bad state

discovery_rule.name: Chassis temperature discovery
discovery_rule.description: The index of a chassis temperature sensor on the system. It identifies a particular chassis temperature sensor, fan, etc.

item_prototype.name: Chassis sensor {#SNMPVALUE} temperature
item_prototype.description: The chassis temperature (in Celsius) of the indexed sensor on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the sensor data is available.

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis temperature ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) of sensor {#SNMPVALUE} exceeds threshold of {$TEMP_HIGH} °C
Chassis temperature ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) of sensor {#SNMPVALUE} exceeds threshold of {$TEMP_WARN} °C

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipBladeOffline)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A blade has failed - offline

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipBladeNoPower)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A blade lost power
trigger.description: The blade may be pulled out

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceConfigSettingChanged)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A configuration has been changed on a device

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLogAlert)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Action must be taken immediately for the system to work properly

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is becoming available in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is becoming unavailable in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is disabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is enabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceConfigSync)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device's configuration is out of sync with its peer

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emCertificateExpiration)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device certificate will expire soon

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceActiveMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-ACTIVE to ACTIVE state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceForcedOfflineMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-FORCED OFFLINE to FORCED OFFLINE state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceOfflineMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-OFFLINE to OFFLINE state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceStandbyMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-STANDBY to STANDBY state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceClockSkew)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device clock is out of sync with EM

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDiskUsage)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A disk partition is exceeding configured usage limits

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipDosAttackStart)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A DOS attack start was detected

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipDosAttackStop)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A DOS attack stop was detected

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmBoxNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A gtm machine (which equates to an iquery connect to a gtm machine) has gone DOWN

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmBoxAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A gtm machine (which equates to an iquery connect to a gtm machine) has gone UP

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipFeatureOnline)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A high availability feature is now responding

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipFeatureFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A high availability feature triggered action failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emHotfixInstallComplete)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A hotfix has been installed on a managed device

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emHotfixInstallFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A hotfix installation has failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is becoming available in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is becoming unavailable in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is disabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is enabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application is becoming available in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application is becoming unavailable in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppObjAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application object is becoming available in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppObjNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application object is becoming unavailable in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipExternalLinkChange)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An external interface link status changes
trigger.description: For a fixed port, this is an occurrence when network cables are connected or removed, and the network is reconfigured; for a pluggable port (such as a SFP or XFP port), this happens when the pluggable unit is plugged in or unplugged, or when a cable is connected or removed from a plugged port. The possible values are UP, DOWN, or UNPOPULATED.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNetLinkDown)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An internal interface link is down
trigger.description: This is for L1 and L2. These are internal links within the box connecting the CPU and Switch subsystems, which should never lose link. If they do, it indicates a serious problem.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceImpaired)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An managed device is impaired

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceUnreachable)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An managed device is unreachable

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNodeRate)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A node has exceeded the allowed rate

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNodeDown)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A node is detected DOWN

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNodeUp)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A node is detected UP

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAomCpuTempTooHigh)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: AOM reports the air temperature near the host CPU too high

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is becoming available in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is becoming unavailable in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is disabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is enabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipMemberRate)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool member has exceeded the allowed rate

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipCpuFanSpeedLow)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipCpuTempHigh)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertCurrentLow)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertFanSpeedLow)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emGatherServiceContractFailure)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Gathering service contract end date failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmp.agent[F5-BIGIP-SYSTEM-MIB::sysGlobalHostCpuUsageRatio1m.0].min(5m)}>{$CPU_WARN}
trigger.name: High CPU load

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipStandByFail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: In failover condition, this standby will not be able to go active

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertMilliVoltageHigh)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Milli-Voltage is too high

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertMilliVoltageLow)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Milli-Voltage is too low

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emStatsCollectionRateCap)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Performance-monitoring data collection rate exceeds recommended limit

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emPerformanceStorageDays)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Performance storage capacity is about to fall below configured number of days

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emPerformanceStorageCap)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Performance storage capacity is lower than the amount of space reserved

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertPowerHigh)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Power is too high

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertPowerLow)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Power is too low

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipPsPowerOff)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Power supply unit has powered off

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipPsPowerOn)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Power supply unit has powered on

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipPsAbsent)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Power supply unit is absent

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Disabled

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Enabled

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolMbrDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Member Disabled

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolMbrEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Member Enabled

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolMbrStatusChange)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Member Status Change

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolMbrStatusChangeReason)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Member Status Change Reason

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolStatusChange)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Status Change

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmProberPoolStatusChangeReason)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Prober Pool Status Change Reason

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emSchedBackupFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Scheduled performance data backup has failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emSoftwareInstallComplete)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Software installation has completed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emSoftwareInstallFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Software installation has failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmp.agent[F5-BIGIP-SYSTEM-MIB::sysProductVersion.0].diff()}=1 or {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmp.agent[F5-BIGIP-SYSTEM-MIB::sysProductBuild.0].diff()}=1 or {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmp.agent[F5-BIGIP-SYSTEM-MIB::sysProductEdition.0].diff()}=1
trigger.name: Software was changed on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSsdMwiReachedThreshold)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: SSD disk wear-out indicator has reached its threshold

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSsdMwiNearThreshold)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: SSD disk wear-out indicator is near its threshold

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLibhalSsdLogicalDiskRemoved)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: SSD logical disk was removed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLibhalSsdPhysicalDiskRemoved)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: SSD physical disk was removed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emStatsDBConnectivityLost)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Statistics database connectivity is lost

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emStatsDBConnectivityRestored)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Statistics database connectivity is restored

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertTempHigh)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Temperature is too high

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAgentRestart)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The agent has been restarted

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAgentStart)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The agent has started running

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAgentShutdown)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The agent is in the process of being shut down

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAggrReaperStateChange)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The aggressive reaper state changed
trigger.description: Aggressive reaper state changes indicate the system is moving into distress-mode for DOS prevention.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipClusterdNoResponse)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The cluster daemon failed to respond for 10 or more seconds

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipCompLimitExceeded)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The compression license limit is exceeded

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emCpuUsage)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The cpu is exceeding configured usage limits

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipDiskPartitionGrowth)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The disk partition exceeds the specified growth limit
trigger.description: By default, the limit is set to 5% of the total disk space. The growth is difference of two consecutive monitoring data.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipDiskPartitionWarn)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The disk partition free space is very limited
trigger.description: Which isless than a specified limit. By default, the limit is set to 30% of total disk space.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipUnsolicitedRepliesExceededThreshold)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The DNS cache object received unsolicited query replies exceeding a configured threshold

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipDnsRequestRateLimiterEngaged)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The DNS Services request rate limiter has been engaged

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAsmFtpRequestViolation)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The FTP request issued a violation to the current active policy
trigger.description: This violation is marked as an alerting violation in that policy in Application Security Module.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAsmFtpRequestBlocked)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The FTP request was blocked
trigger.description: Because it issued (at least one) violation(s) which is marked as blocking at the current active policy in Application Security Module.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmRequestRateLimiterEngaged)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The GTM request rate limiter has been engaged

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAsmRequestViolation)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The HTTP request issued a violation to the current active policy
trigger.description: This violation is marked as an alerting violation in that policy in Application Security Module.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAsmRequestBlocked)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The HTTP request was blocked
trigger.description: Because it issued (at least one) violation(s) which is marked as blocking at the current active policy in Application Security Module.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLicenseExpired)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The license has expired

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLicenseFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The license validation failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAuthFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The login/sshd authentication has failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipPacketRejected)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The packets are rejected

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipClusterPrimaryChanged)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The primary blade has been changed in the cluster system

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipUpdatePriority)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: There is a high priority software update available

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipARPConflict)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: There is an ARP conflict

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipUpdateError)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: There was an error checking for updates

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAsmSmtpRequestViolation)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The SMTP request issued a violation to the current active policy
trigger.description: This violation is marked as an alerting violation in that policy in Application Security Module.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAsmSmtpRequestBlocked)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The SMTP request was blocked
trigger.description: Because it issued (at least one) violation(s) which is marked as blocking at the current active policy in Application Security Module.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSslLimitExceeded)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The SSL license limits are exceeded
trigger.description: Either for TPS (Transactions Per Second) or for MPS (Megabits Per Second).

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLogErr)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system has some error conditions

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLogWarning)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system is experiencing some warning conditions

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipActiveActive)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system is going into active-active mode

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipActive)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system is going into active mode

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipStandby)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system is going into standby mode

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLogCrit)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system is in a critical condition

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLogEmerg)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system is in an unusable situation

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemShutdown)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system is shutting down

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emMemoryUsage)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system memory is exceeding configured usage limits

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emRaidDriveFailureDetected)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system RAID drive failure has been detected

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emRaidDriveRebuildComplete)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The system RAID drive rebuild is complete

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipInetPortExhaustion)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: The TMM has run out of source ports and cannot open new communications channels with other machines

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emPerformanceThreshold)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Threshold has been violated for a performance-data object

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipTamdAlert)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Too many authentication failures (> 60) in 1 second to TMM (Traffic Management Module)

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipUpdateServer)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Unable to connect to the F5 Update Check server

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertVoltageHigh)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Voltage is too high

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipSystemCheckAlertVoltageLow)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Voltage is too low

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmp.agent[F5-BIGIP-SYSTEM-MIB::sysSystemUptime.0].change()}<0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has just been restarted
